nodes.text: President Bush attacked the Senate this week for having a  lousy record  of confirming his judicial nominees.
The Senate does not have a lousy record of confirming President Bush's judicial nominees.

If the Democratic-controlled Senate confirmed more of Bush's judicial nominees in in its first 15 months than the Senate did in the final 30 months when led by Bush's own Republican party the Democratic led Senate does not have a lousy record of confirming judicial nominees.

The Democratic-controlled Senate confirmed 80 judges in its first 15 months in power - more than the Republican-led Senate confirmed in its final 30 months in control from 1999 through the summer of 2001.
